name: Amerindios
description: '''Amerindios''' was a [[folk music]] group from [[Chile]] which was active in the years between 1969 and 1973. It was one of the many artists of the [[Nueva Canción]] movement, but unlike many other Nueva Canción artists, Amerindios also incorporated instruments such as [[electric guitar]]s. The group was formed in [[Santiago, Chile|Santiago]] in 1969 by [[Mario Salazar]] and one of the three founders of [[Quilapayún]], [[Julio Numhauser]]. [[Patricio Castillo (folk musician)|Patricio Castillo]] joined the group later in 1971, two years before the group broke up.
